title: Little Red Riding Hood
brief_description: Disney’s 1922 animated version of Little Red Riding Hood was one of the first moving image works of the famous cautionary tale not to talk to strangers.

constellations_other.name: Cautionary tales and magic lantern projectors
constellations_other.description: Early magic lantern projections depicted cautionary religious scenes and fairytales, just like cinema did in its infancy.

description: Mother is making donuts: She throws up a circle of dough, and a cat shoots a hole in it. Later, he fishes them out of the oil with a fishing line; he eats one, and loses all 9 lives. Mother puts together a basket for Red to take to granny. Red uses her cart, which is pushed by her little dog; the cart gets a flat tire, and she inflates a donut to replace it. A wolf (a human lothario) drives by in a flivver, and dashes off to grandma’s house, where he finds a note saying she’s gone to the movies. He shrinks his car and stashes it in his pocket, then waits for Red, who stopped to watch a dancing flower. Red arrives, and they go into the house, where he attempts to have his way with her. The dog rushes off and gets help from an airplane pilot, who uses a skyhook to remove the house and, ultimately, lift the wolf in his car and drop him in the lake. Written by Jon Reeves
